metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14997 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation) because of an integer underflow in ReadPICTImage in coders/pict.c. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14997` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm4').
